alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued September 14 at 4:19PM AKDT until September 17 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING FOR THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... The National Weather Service in Anchorage has issued a Coastal Flood Watch, which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Saturday morning. * LOCATION...The Kuskokwim Delta Coast, including Kuskokwim Bay. * COASTAL FLOODING...Water levels are expected to rise 4 to 7 feet above the normal highest tide line. * TIMING...From Friday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Low lying areas could flood. Some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion could occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A potent storm system, the extra-tropical remnants of Typhoon Merbok, is expected to move from the Northern Pacific Thursday, through the Southern Bering Thursday night and Friday morning, and into the Northern Bering Sea late Friday into Saturday. Winds are expected to increase by late morning Friday and continue through Saturday morning before slowly diminishing Saturday night. The combination of strong winds and fetch will also produce a storm surge along the coast, leading to the potential for coastal erosion and flooding along the Kuskokwim Delta coast.
info.instruction: A coastal flood watch means that conditions favorable for flooding are expected to develop. Coastal residents should be alert for later statements or warnings, and take action to protect property.
